intro: Cheiridopsis latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and unique flowering structures. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the spring and summer months. Cheiridopsis latifolia is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
